para.emphasis: The job manager detected an invalid script response

listitem.simpara: Check for a restrictive umask. When the service writes the native scheduler job description to a file, an overly restrictive umask will cause the permissions on the file to be such that the submission script run through sudo as the user cannot read the file (bug #2655).

para.emphasis: Fork jobs work fine, but submitting PBS jobs with globusrun-ws hangs at "Current job state: Unsubmitted"

listitem.simpara: Make sure the the log_path in $GLOBUS_LOCATION/etc/globus-pbs.conf points to locally accessible scheduler logs. The Scheduler Event Generator (SEG) will not work without local scheduler logs to monitor. This can also apply to other resource managers, but is most comonly seen with PBS.

If the SEG configuration is sane, then you will have to debug the PBS adapter to figure out what error is not being propegated back to the client. See Debugging script execution in the Developer's Guide.
